contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=August 2009}} [[Image:Yoshino District in Nara Prefecture.png|thumb|250px|topright|Location of Yoshino District in Nara Prefecture]] {{nihongo|'''Yoshino'''|吉野郡|Yoshino-gun}} is a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Nara Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the district has an estimated [[population]] of 59,020 and a [[population density|density]] of 26.14 persons per km². The total area is 2,257.79 km². == Towns and villages == *[[Higashiyoshino, Nara|Higashiyoshino]] *[[Kamikitayama, Nara|Kamikitayama]] *[[Kawakami, Nara|Kawakami]] *[[Kurotaki, Nara|Kurotaki]] *[[Nosegawa, Nara|Nosegawa]] *[[Ōyodo, Nara|Ōyodo]] *[[Shimoichi, Nara|Shimoichi]] *[[Shimokitayama, Nara|Shimokitayama]] *[[Tenkawa, Nara|Tenkawa]] *[[Totsukawa, Nara|Totsukawa]] *[[Yoshino, Nara|Yoshino]] == Mergers == *On September 25, 2005 the villages of [[Ōtō, Nara|Ōtō]] and [[Nishiyoshino, Nara|Nishiyoshino]] merged into the city of [[Gojō, Nara|Gojō]]. {{Nara Prefecture}} {{coord|34.137|N|135.97|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts in Nara Prefecture]] {{Nara-geo-stub}}
